Package Controller

Class AppointmentScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.AppointmentScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AppointmentScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class controls the Appointment screen. The Appointment screen allows the user to view and filter all appointments, add/modify/delete appointments.

    • Method Detail

      • onActionApplyFilters

        void onActionApplyFilters​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method applies user selected filters to data displayed in tableview. User input is gathered from dropDownTime and dropDownContact comboboxes and used as arguments (filters) when retrieving appointments from the database. The tableview is automatically updated.
        Parameters:
        event - Executes when the user presses the Apply button.

      • onActionResetFilter

        void onActionResetFilter​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        The method resets the dropDownTime and dropDownContact comboboxes to their respective original prompts and null values. The tableview is updated automatically.
        Parameters:
        event - Executes when the user presses the reset button.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In the event of an IO error.

      • onActionMainMenu

        void onActionMainMenu​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This method returns the user to the Main Menu. returns user the Main Menu.
        Parameters:
        event - Executes when the user presses the Main Menu button.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In the event of an IO error.

      • onActionAddAppointment

        void onActionAddAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method loads the Add Appointment screen. Loads the Add Appointment screen.
        Parameters:
        event - Executes when the user presses the Add button.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In the event of an IO error.

      • onActionModifyAppointment

        void onActionModifyAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This method loads the Modify Appointment screen. Loads the Modify Appointment screen.
        Parameters:
        event - Executes when the user presses the Modify button.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In the event of an IO error.

      • onActionDeleteAppointment

        void onActionDeleteAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.sql.SQLException
        This method deletes appointment data from the database. After user confirms deletion in a dialog box, this method deletes appointment data from the database, then provides confirmation of deletion in another dialog box.
        Parameters:
        event - Executes when the user presses the Delete button.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In the event of an IO error.
        java.sql.SQLException - In the event of an SQL error.

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        This method initializes the Appointment screen. Here the tableview, dropDownTime and dropDownContact comboboxes are populated. LAMBDA #1 - populates list of Contact names
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - the location
        resourceBundle - the resources
